intro: Rhytachne mannii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers that resemble buttercups. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and along stream banks. Rhytachne mannii is valued for its ornamental appeal and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
